Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: PARTECIPAZIONE A CONVEGNI COME RELATORE 1) “Alexander of Aphrodisias and the heterodox dictum de omni et de nullo.” Recent research on the Prior Analytics and its Greek, Arabic and Latin reception. Université Paris Diderot, 15 January 2015. 2) “Alexander of Aphrodisias on Mixed Modal Syllogistic.” Modal Syllogistic. University of Lisbon, 11-13 September 2014. 3) “Albert the Great on Comparative Relations.” European Symposium on Medieval Logic and Semantics. Cambridge (UK), 12-16 June 2014. 4) “Albert the Great and Thomas Aquinas on the Distinction of Theoretical Habits.” SAGP-SSIPS Joint Meeting. Fordham University (Lincoln Center), Manhattan, New York, 24-26 October 2014. 5) “A fortiori arguments in classical rhetoric: a logical analysis.” International Society for the Study of Argumentation. Universiteit van Amsterdam, 1-4 July 2014. 6) “ 'Who will inherit the Kingdom of God’? Thomas Aquinas and Dante on the insufficiency of the observance of the Decalogue in order to be saved.” The Ten Commandments in medieval and early modern culture. Universiteit Gent, 10-11 April 2014. 7) “What should we reduce any given syllogism to? Ockham's paradigm change with respect to the very basis of syllogistic.” Analysis and Synthesis. Philosophical Method and Scientific Methodology in Ancient and Medieval Thought. Amsterdam, Vrije Universiteit, 18-21 December 2013. 8) “Truth conditions for contingency propositions in Thomas Aquinas.” Beauty and Truth in Ancient and Medieval Philosophy. Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam, 21-23 August 2013. 9) “On Aristotle's controversial acceptance of the principle of plenitude in Metaphysics Theta, 4.” Aristotle Reading Party. St. Andrews University, Scotland (UK), 29 April - 1 May 2013. 10) “Does Aquinas's tertia via entail the principle of plenitude?.” The Dominicans and the Challenge of Thomism. Pontifical Faculty of the Immaculate Conception, Dominican House of Studies, Washington D.C., 1-5 July 2013. 11) “Averroes and Aquinas on the principle of plenitude. Aquinas and Arabic Metaphysics.” Würzburg University (Germany), 7-8 June 2013. 12) “A New Account of Aristotelian Endurantism.” Salzburgiense Concilium Omnibus Philosophis Analyticis. Fachbereich Philosophie der Paris-Lodron-Universität Salzburg, 12-14 September 2013. 13) “Aristotle and Antisthenes as Reliable Sources for the ‘Non-Platonic’ Socrates, and their Account of Socrates’ Main Philosophical Tenets.” Socratica. University of Trent (Trent, Italy), 23-25 February 2012. 14) “Alexander of Aphrodisias and the heterodox dictum de omni et de nullo.” Expanding the canon of Ancient Philosophy. Amsterdam, 30 January-2 February 2012. 15) “Renovantur studia, et homines perveniunt ad opiniones veras quae prius fuerant. Alcuni aspetti dell’attività filologica di Tommaso d’Aquino.” Classics Scholars. Their Works and Methods. University of Turin, Turin, 30 June 2011. 16) “Paul of Venice on the Definition of Accidents.” Renaissance Society of America – Annual Meeting, Humboldt University of Berlin, 25-28 March 2015. 17) “Non normal modal logics in Thomas Aquinas.” World Congress on Universal Logic, Istanbul, 20-30 June 2015. 19) “Aristotelian Plenitude. Aristotle and Thomas Aquinas on the Principle of Plenitude.” Meeting of the Medieval Philosophy Network, The Warburg Institute, London, 19 June 2015. 20) “Alexander of Aphrodisias on Mixed Modal Syllogistic.” London Ancient Science Conference, Institute of Classical Studies, Senate House, London, 16-18 February 2015.

Conseguimento di premi e riconoscimenti.content: Marco Arosio Award, Rome, for the paper ‘Thomas Aquinas’s Commentary on Aristotle’s Metaphysics. Prolegomena to the Study of the Text’. 2000 euros. 2015. Asveld Foundation, Leuven. 1500 euros. 2011-2012. Emilio Bocca Award, University of Torino and Scuola Normale Superiore. Best MA dissertation in Philosophy. 2000 euros. 2010. Journal of Liberty and Society. Top paper award. 500 US dollars. 2010. Certamen Viterbense, Viterbo. Translation from the Greek. 300 euros. 2006. Certamen Sophocleum, Termoli. Translation from the Greek. 1000 euros. 2005. Membro della Societé pour l'étude de la philosophie médiévale Membro della Società italiana per lo studio del pensiero medievale

Partecipazione al collegio dei docenti o.content: Professore al dipartimento di filosofia dell'Université du Québec à Montréal. (Insegno anche all'interno del programma di dottorato del dipartimento di filosofia dell'UQAM).

Specifiche esperienze professionali cara.content: Professore di filosofia antica al dipartimento di filosofia della Université du Québec à Montréal (UQAM), Montréal, Canada

Formale attribuzione di incarichi di ins.content: Fellow del Fonds Wetenschappelijk Onderzoek - Vlaanderen
